links.title: Benzinga's Bulls & Bears Of The Week: Apple, Facebook, Nike, Tesla And More
links.description: Benzinga has featured looks at many investor favorite stocks over the past week. Bullish calls included the iPhone maker and one of the big banks. Bearish calls included a leading newspaper publisher and a sportswear giant. The broader markets saw modest gains to start off the second half of 2018, led by the Nasdaq with its more than 3 percent bump this past week.

links.title: Marker Maker Moves For The Big Stocks - 7/8/2018
links.description: The expected move that a stock makes is very important to know. The easiest way to get an idea of the move is to price a straddle at the close of trading on Friday. That is buying one call and one put at an ATM strike.

links.title: Will Investors Ignore Trump's Trade War for Much Longer?
links.description: Stocks survived day one of the trade war on Friday. It's anyone's guess if they can keep dodging bullets. Dow Jones Industrial Average futures rose 18 points on Sunday as of 6:04 p.m., S&P 500 futures gained slightly, and Nasdaq Composite ^IXIC futures advanced 2 points.

links.title: China hits back at Trump's tariffs
links.description: â–º Read more at https://on.ft.com/2MYvWls Beijing accused Donald Trump of "trade bullying" as it imposed retaliatory tariffs against new US duties on $34bn of Chinese imports. The FT's world trade editor, Shawn Donnan, reports from Washington DC about the consequences of the escalating trade battle.
